subject: Philosophy
title: Karma and Rebirth
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Karma and Rebirth.

hook.text: Karma isn't cosmic revenge. It's closer to Newton's third law: every action has consequences.

buildup.text: In Buddhism, karma means intentional action. Good intentions lead to good outcomes, eventually.

discovery.text: Rebirth isn't about a soul moving between bodies. It's patterns of energy continuing after death.

twist.text: A candle lights another candle. The flame isn't the same, but it's not entirely different either.

climax.text: Karma isn't fate. It's feedback. Your choices now shape your experience â€” in this life and beyond.

punchline.text: What you do now echoes forward.

quiz.question: How does Buddhism describe karma?
options: Intentional actions that create future consequences
